Title: Heavy Metal
Author: Dan Goldberg  Len Blum
Genre: Action  Adventure  Animation  Fantasy  Horror  Sci-Fi

AUSTIN is crouched over the machine turning several knobs, trying to make the ball move.  Nothing happens.
Hmmm ... must be jammed.
Where'd it go?
With an explosion that rocks the universe, a huge chunk rips out of the green planet and shoots off into space, leaving thousands of glowing particles in its wake.

The WITCH'S green ball zooms through space, as Earth appears in the distance.  Then another object comes into sight.  Getting closer we see that is is a modern winged rocketplane of no determinable nationality, soaring high above Earth.  The green meteorite passes, briefly bathing the rocketplane in its glow.
The round spaceship blasts forward at ten times the speed of light.

From the forest floor we see the green planetoid fly overhead, dropping balls.  We watch as it moves away and disappears beyond a far-off mountain range.  The forest rumbles as the planetoid crashes in the distance.

Characters.Character: A GREEN BALL NEAR HER FEET

Replies.Reply: An ominous note is struck as the girl notices the glowing ball, and is drawn to it.  Picking the sphere up, she looks at it.  Something inside her warns her of its danger, but, unable to resist, she puts it in her basket and continues on.
Silence!
We are not a race of warriors.
One of Taarak's blood can do much.
It is Taarna, of the blood of Taarak the Defender - the last of the race.  And must be summoned as my forefathers summoned Taarak himself - from within!
A Taarakian has no choice.  They must answer.  It is in their blood.
Bar the door.
We will summon the Defender together.
Taarna ... Taarna ...
Elder!  They are at the walls!
They are in the halls!  They are coming!!
I owe you my life.  Let me repay you ...
He is still sitting on the floor, working on his machine.
Where the hell are we?

Keep your shirts on guys, tonight I'm gonna hit something.
Left two degrees ... steady ...

Oh I put my finger in a woodpecker's hole and the woodpecker said God bless my soul; take it out, take it out, take it out, remove it ...

Japanese soldiers crank the barrel of an anti-aircraft gun skyward.  We begin to hear the sound of approaching engines.
It is thrust into a breech.
We're there Stepek, right on target ... Rabual dead ahead!
C'mon Stepek, there's the whole island of Rabaul down there, you can't miss!
Navigator check.
Something's wrong!
I must have a malfunction, my compass says we're heading north!
Hey, can you guys see the rest of the squadron?
Mine too, we must have hit a magnetic field or something !!
Skip, with everything screwed up here, I'd, I'd guess about two hundred miles.
It's all ocean down there, skip!
Stepek, you stupid sonovabitch, will you lay off the booze, you've got the D.T.'s ...
What's the problem, skip?
What is it, skip?
JESUS H. CHRIST!
Okay you little bastards ... shit ...
Quit yer bitching Stepek, just drop 'em and let's get outta here!

Belly okay.
Sorry about Elkhorn, skip.

Negative, there's too much cloud.
Jesus!  Look at that!!
It's out there, just look at it ...
It's about four o'clock, just below ... Holy Shit, it's coming right at us!
Will do, skipper.
Gulp, ah ... I'm ah ... okay ... I think.
Ah ... tail okay ...
Yeah ... will do, skipper.
Skipper, Bellson and Lewis are both dead.
Hey Stepek, just shut up, okay?
Button it up, we're almost there.
We took a hit ...
Shit.  Elkhorn just bought it.
Nice shooting Stepek, how are the rest of you guys?
Bellson ... Lewis?
Kid, check the waist positions, see if they're okay.
Let's go home.
Dammit!
I dunno.  The shell exploded and he collapsed.  I think he took it in the head.
He's dead.
You got a problem, Holden?
Button it up Stepek.  What's the problem, Holden?
He looks at his compass.
Mine says east.
What the hell ...
Hey Holden, now my compass has gone crazy.  It's spinning like a son of a bitch!
Christ, now they're all doing it!!
Can it Stepek, we got real problems.
Look at what ... look at what!!?
For Christ sake, give us a position!
Damn.
We lost the goddamned prop ...
Come in kid ... kid are you okay?
Travis; go check the back.
Goddamn it, now what?
Gremlins!
Jesus, I must be getting tired.
Travis, what's goin' on back there?
Holden, how far to base?
For Christ's sake, find us a place I can put her down!
Mack, can you get us a radio fix?
Shit!  I've gotta put her down!
For God sakes Stepek, shut up!
Holden, for God's sake get up here on the double.
Just get up here!
Hold 'em off.  I'm taking her down.
Jesus H. Christ!
Flight Engineer okay.
Radio okay.
Negative skip, too much interference.
Cheers and whoops.
His eyes are open but he is obviously dead.  Through his helmet headphone, we hear his name.
He is losing his grip with one hand, but still desperately clinging on to a bunch of cables with the other.  Suddenly an ugly pincer cuts the cables and STEPEK is gone ... out into the night.
It's broken again, isn't it Daddy?
How come it's always breaking?
When it's fixed, will you make more funny pictures for me?
Okay.
Behold!  The Sphere of Uluhtec!
Take it !!
Doctor Anrak, six more mutants were sighted in Arizona this morning.  Do you still say this has nothing to do with the green radiation from space.
... well what I wanna know is, what's the Army doing about this?
Senator, we have no proof that these mutations are the result of interference from outer space.  In fact, Doctor Anrak has just come in, so let's hear what he has to say ... Doctor?

First of all, there is no cause for alarm.  As for the theories of interference by alien beings, it is my firm opinion that we on Earth are the only intelligent, technically advanced civilization present in the universe.
... and whatever is causing these mutations is not from outer space.
Pretty ... pretty ... p ... p ...
Aaarrgghh!
Eeeeeek!
Oh, nice job.  How am I supposed to fix this guy?  He's fucked.
You're sorry?  What about me?
Hey, who's the chick?
Too late - molecular instability zone around spacecraft. You cannot leave.
Not anymore.  Would you, ah, like a drink?
You'll feel better after a glass of fresh blo-aak.
Oh great.  I have been programmed to be fully proficient in sexual activities.
Ah, what he does not know will not hurt him.
... but I don't understand.  We laugh together.  We care for each other.  We have highly proficient sex.  Why can't we get married?
robots.
Okay, okay!
I guess we turned it up a little too high.
Uh ...
... oh yeah.  Instability zone.
Hey, do we have any of that Plutonian Nyborg left?
Uh, thanks man.
Oh great.  Think this is enough?
Good thinking, man.
Whaddyawant, man?
Oh yeah.
Whaddyawant man?
Yeah, sure.  Whaddyawant, man?
It's about time.  Hang on, man.
No problem, man.

It's okay, man.  If there's one thing I know, it's how to drive when I'm stoned.  It's like, you know your perspective's fucked, so you just gotta let your hands work the controls as if you're straight.
Thanks.
They gotta give him at least, like, life.
Yeah.  It's like pig city out here.
There it is, man.  I'm gonna hang a louie here.
He doesn't even look Jewish!
Sorry, man.
Ah, typical robot.  The first Earth-chick we see in ten years, and he's gotta make a play for her.
Uh, yeah.  Just one bag.  Uh, it's in the transmitter compartment.
Uhh ... nah.  Go for broke.
Oh, wow ... good Nyborg!
You gotta use the microphone.
Wow!  They finally got Sternn.
You okay to land this thing?
I think you're goin' a little high, man.
Oh, wow, good landing, man.
Umm, you're gonna testify at Sternn's trial?
Y'know, I wish they'd clean this place up, man.
Yeah.
Yeah, well it won't be long now.  Are you sure you're gonna testify for Sternn.
I give them six months, man.
Where am I?
Well look at my clothes!
What?!  Is he kidding?
But I have to be at my parents for dinner tonight.  And my gynecologist appointment is on Wednesday.
Do you have any diet soda?
That was incredible.  I've never felt anything like it.
Gee, I don't know.  I already have a boyfriend.
Look, we're different, okay?  Let's leave it at that.
... but mixed marriages just don't work.  What if you get tired of me and run off with a vibrator or something?
... alright, alright.  I'll marry you - but on one condition ... I want a Jewish wedding.
Well, find me a robot-rabbi!

ZEKE and EDSEL are sitting at the controls, staring wide-eyed out into space.  They are obviously stoned.  Suddenly a bell rings and the communicator screen lights up.  A serious officer's face appears on it.
ZEKE and EDSEL are sitting at the controls, driving carefully.
Mothership calling starcruiser Alpha ...
Mothership calling Starcruiser Alpha ...
Now listen, idiot.  Do I have to tell you eight hundred times?  You don't call me "man"!  You call me "Com-Op Officer Blix". Now is that perfectly clear?

You are to return immediately to the Mother Ship and pick up a humanoid civilian.  Your orders are to escort him to the Interplanetary Tribunal Courtroom so that he can testify at the trial of Lincoln Sternn.  And make it snappy!
Thenk yew.  Clik.
Ah, hello.
Lincoln Sternn is a kind and honourable man.
He will be freed.
I am Hanover Fiste.
Yes, I know Captain Sternn.  And never did there live a kinder, more generous man.  He is an overflowing cup, filled with the very cream of human goodness ...
... in all the time I've known him, he's never done anything immoral ...
unless maybe the Pre-Schooler's Prostitute ring ...
... and he's ah, never done anything illegal ...
... unless you count all the times he sold dope disguised as a nun!!
He's always been a good, law-abiding citizen ...
Awww, gimme a break!!
... of the Federation, and, and ...
Shut Up!  Shut Up!  Shut Up!
... a community-concious individual, ah, ah ...
STERNN!!!
He's nothin' but a low-down, double-dealin', back-stabbin', larcenous, perverted worm!!
Hangin's too good for him!!
Burnin's too good for him!!
He should be torn into little bitsy pieces and buried alive!!!
I'll kill him!
KII - ILLL!!!
I'll get you!!
Sternn!!!
STERNN!!
S'nothin, boss.
Yes?
ZEKE and EDSEL escort FISTE down the corridor.
The ship locks into the dock, and the exit hatch opens.
Are you Captain Lincoln F. Sternn?
Lincoln Sternn - you stand here accused of twelve counts of murder in the first degree  ... fourteen counts of armed theft of Federation property ...
... twenty-two counts of piracy in high space ... eighteen counts of fraud ...
... thirty-seven counts of rape, and one moving violation.  How do you plead?
The Prosecution calls Hanover Fiste.
State your name for the record.
Captain Sternn?
I am.
Not guilty!
It's okay, Charlie.  I got an angle.
I told you, Charlie.  I got an angle.
Shut up, Charlie.  I got an angle.
Him!
I promised him thirty-five thousand zuleks to testify on my behalf.
See?
Hanover ...
Hanover ...
H-h-hey, Hanover ...
Running down a hallway, STERNN passes a group of Regolian cops, who raise their weapons in an attempt to block the rampaging FISTE.
He races through a metallic hallway, and ducks into a boiler room, then down a long dark tunnel.  At the end of the tunnel, STERNN comes to a dead-end, and stops to rest.
Oh, this looks good.
Oh, duck under here ...
I think I'll turn here!
Come on feet, don't fail me now!
Uh oh ...
Ah, gasp, ah whew, lost him!
Okay, Hanover, you've had this coming!
Let's see, thirty-three, thirty-
And Hanover ...
Goodbye.
Smiling to himself, he nods, then gets serious.
Not guilty?!?  Are you nuts?!?
But the Prosecutor's gotcha cold!
Lissen Sternn ... change the plea to guilty.  Throw yerself on the mercy of the court.
But the most we can hope for is to get ya buried in secrecy so yer grave don't get violated!  Plead guilty!
What angle?
Call the first witness!
They look at each other, shocked.
She swoops down and flies through a maze of rusting pipes and cables which look like the ramnants of an ancient power station.
To defend - this is the Pact.
Beyond the oasis.

It all started when I found the green meteorite.  I read in Farraday's "Life of the Planets" that smaller ones like this are supposed to burn up when they enter the atmosphere, but for some reason this one didn't ...
... so I brought it up to my room, stuck it in my rock collection and forgot about it.  I was experimenting with natural electricity ...
... and with the storm warnings up, I figured maybe tonight I'd hit the jackpot.  All I needed was a little juice.
It works!
Oh Jesus!
I felt like I was nothing - just atoms floating in the darkness ...
Then, a body started to re-form around me.  Only it wasn't my body - this one had muscles.
It was a great body, but I wasn't too crazy about the face.
There was no way I was gonna walk around this place with my dork hangin' out!
Wow!  This looked like something right out of the Ten Commandments.
What'd they do that for?
Normally, I'd be dead by now.  I kept thinking I was going to run out of air, but my new body worked great.  I just hoped her body was working as good as mine.
She had the most beautiful eyes.
You're not kidding.
Wow!  This was great!  There was no way I'd get a chick like this back on Earth.  I mean, look at her!!
There was only one problem ...
I don't know who these jerks were, but they sure picked a bad time to show up ...
They split us up and took me to this weird castle-type place.
This guy was a shrimp so I figured I'd play it tough.
Uh oh.
Boy!  I was pretty good at this stuff.
I could see why they made this guy their leader.
Sounded reasonable to me.
This guy Norl seemed to know what he was doing.  And, for a gorilla, his English wasn't half bad.
Wow!  It was just like the ball I dug up in my back yard.
As I saw the Loc-Nar's glow I had this real funny feeling.  All by themselves, my hands reached forward to touch it.  But the Loc-Nar moved out of the way.
Talk about embarassing!
Uh oh.
Wow!  Eighteen years of nuthin' and now, twice in one day.  What a place!
I had no idea what she was talking about.
I knew I was good, but I didn't know I was that good.
Boy, was she pissed off!
They probably went back to Earth.
On Earth, I'm nobody.  But here, I am DEN.
Hmmm ... no hair.
Hmmm ... big!
Are you from around here?
Earth?  I too am from Earth.
I, too seem better equipped on this world.
My arms are more powerful.
Even my fingers seem to hold great strength.
Where is the girl?
The girl!!
Give me the girl or die.
So be it.
She's dead.
What do you want of me?
What is this Loc-Nar?
And if I refuse?
What are they saying?
What must I do?
Mmmm.
Yes, a sign.
Katherine!
Katherine!
Holding KATHERINE in one arm, DEN smashes a nearby soldier and grabs the beast's spear.  With the battle raging all around him, DEN looks up at the sky.

DEN reaches down, picks up the long chain that was wrapped around the glass case and attaches one end to his spear.  He kicks the other end into the raging water, then heaves the spear with all his might into the head of the stone idol.
They are gone.  That is all that matters.
Forget it.
I like it better here.
Uluhtec, Ulutec ...
By the powers of the glowing Loc-Nar placed in your idol's hand, I demand you come forth, Uluhtec!
Grant me your strength in return for a living mortal sacrifice!  It has been ordained.  Come forth Uluhtec!
Kill them.
Yes, slit his throat.
Stop!  I have, ah, something better in mind.
If you please me, I may let you live.
Satisfy my appetites.
Come with me.
The rising moon climaxes our love, Den.  Is is a sign, a new beginning.
Neverwhere is a troubled land, but together we could calm it.
Fiend!  You make love to me while your accomplices steal the magic sphere!  Guards!  Take him!
Hold him still!  I will kill him myself!
Prepare the flying lizards.
The Loc-Nar!
Faster!  To the pyramid!
The Loc-Nar is mine!
The QUEEN is kneeling before the seething water.
Reaching her, DEN grabs the girl's  bound ankles, hooks them over his head and drags her through a decayed hole in the underwater wall.  Inside a stone tunnel, they are swept along by the current.
Thank you.
Well, you may not believe this, but I'm from another world - from a place called Earth.
My name is Katherine Wells, and I'm from the British colony of Gibraltar.  Time makes no diff-
Father!
Help me, please!!
The Loc-Nar ... they wanted it ... but my father wouldn't tell them ... now I'm the only one ...
Where am I?
They'd have killed me if it wasn't for you.
You saved my life.  I have no reward to give you, but if any part of me pleases your senses - I would give it willingly.
Den!
Where did they go?
The Loc-Nar ... you could have the power of Uluhtec.  You could be ruler over all these people.
Oh, but Den, with the Loc-Nar you could have returned to Earth.
They tell me you are Den of Earth, the one who dared to steal the female sacrifice from the Queen.
I am Ard - supreme leader of the revolution and the next ruler of the world.
Well, aren't we fierce?
Excellent.  You are worthy to serve me.
Well, if I have a choice, I'll take death.
Ha ha ha!  You'll have to do better than that.
... but if you're really interested in the girl; I've had her encased in glass.
Actually no.  She's sleeping, but only I can awaken her.
I want you to steal the sacred Loc-Nar.
The Queen's glowing sphere, you fool.  The sacrifice to Uluhtec can only be performed by the possessor of the sacret Loc-Nar.
Norl!
This is Norl, my bravest warrior.
If you refuse, you die, she dies, everybody dies.
By the power of the magic Loc-Nar placed in your idol's hands, I command you - come forth Uluhtec!
Here is your sacrifice, Uluhtec.
No!  You'll ruin everything!
Kill them!  Kill them both!
Stupid bitch!  Get away from me!
Ssh.  Guard post ahead.  We must go underground.
We're underneath the castle moat.
They talk of the savage beast who prowls these catacombs with a fierce hunger and sharp teeth ...
six inches long.
Sorry ...
... sixteen inches long.
Now we separate.  You and Korg take this door into the Queen's quarters.    The rest of us will move through the walls and enter her chamber from the other side.
The group, carrying torches, moves along the dark tunnel.  They pass a bubble-window with shark-faced eels swimming on the other side.
DEN, NORL, and the remaining warriors arrive at a door in the rock wall.
Loc-Nar.
Can I slit his throat, your Majesty?
Thank you, your Majesty.
Look, she's the Queen.  She can do whatever she wants.
Your Majesty!  The Loc-Nar is missing - stolen!
There he is, your Majesty!

The people appears to be a band of aboriginal workmen, carrying futuristic laser-shovels over their shoulders.  They are led by a goateed archaeologist with an elaborate metal detector.  As he walks, his detector starts bleeping.  He points to a spot on the ground, and the natives start digging with their laser-
Kuma!  Kuma!  Kuma!
Yeah, New York, big deal.  Scum-centre of the world.
... and now they're talking about letting in low-lifes from other planets, too.
Yeah.  Get in.
My name's Harry Canyon.  I drive a cab.
Where to, pal?
The U.N. Building.  What a joke.
This city is really going to the dogs.
Stupid asshole.  Nobody touches me unless I want 'em to.
Normally my rule is "Don't get involved", but something about this dame got to me.
Relax sister.  There's a cop station up here.  You can ...
Just what I needed ... guess I'm a sucker for a pretty face.
I wanna report a murder.
You gonna let me in or what?
Yeah thanks ...
... for nuthin'!
So here I was, stuck with this beautiful girl.  I knew she was gonna be nuthin' but trouble ...
... but I didn't feel right just leaving her for the sickos.  I dunno, maybe I'm gettin' sentimental or something ...
My place ...
What'd they want to snuff you for?
You free?
The U.N. Building.
Okay sucker, hand over your cash, now!
Run!
He's dead.  Get the girl!
The police station is an all-metal building with no windows.
Police.  Whaddya want?
So what else is new?
Before you go any further pal, I gotta tell you, it's cash up front.  A thousand bucks a day for a full investigation.
You think you can do better?
I tell you I'm an American citizen.
Goddamn illegal aliens.
